captions.text: Now the season has finished. The boys have had a lot of stresses, whether they were physical, or mental.
So the boys really need to get away from football, we say for the first two weeks.
All the boys have been given an off-season programme so that when they come into pre-season,
they aren't starting from zero. That can't happen with a professional athlete.
If we look at it as a six-week period, two weeks are rest and recuperation. Following that I go into building
that base back up for the next two weeks. And the last two weeks is building up some of the
more interval fashion work. So building your speed work back up there.
This is your programme we're going to work twice a week. These drills, you'll build on top of each other.
So we'll start with the endurance base and then you'll add some of the more intensive interval training.
And then we'll start building the velocity base work back up so its not a shock when you come to the pre-season.
This is a continuous drill that we're going to split up into 3 blocks of 10 minutes.
In between each 10 minute block we're having a 3 minute recovery and we'll be doing our exercises.
So we're going to cover the marking on the pitch. We'll go across diagonally, then across the width of the pitch,
and then back across diagonal, back across the width and then you start again. And that is continuous for 10 minutes.
When you actually look at the profile of a professional match, a lot of the time is spent during a low aerobic capacity
so we need to make sure that we tick that box. We're looking for you to hit 1 minute, 45 seconds to 2 minutes for 1 lap.
1, well done. I don't want them to continuously run much longer than that. I break it up with some general movement
patterns and some injury prevention work. So we're not looking for this arch in the back here, try to tuck
that underneath. Keep this nice and solid. There we go, just 5 reps. Keeping those glutes working.
Big step, good. Keep that chest big and rotate with that arm. Hold it for 3 seconds, stand up tall. Come in with the other leg,
big step, walk out. Next one we're going to get a bit of core control. I want you to do 4 reps of this.
Walk the feet in, feel the tension on the hamstrings. Next one, we go through our lunge matrix, now you know what that is.
4 forwards, 4 to the side and then 4 off to the 45 degree angle. Facing forwards, good.
3 nice and slow and then we're going to do 3 quick ones. The next drill we're going to do incorporates
a few more changes in pace. We're going to run to the six yard box, run back to the line, to the 18 yard box,
back to the line. Running up to the half way line, back and you start again. So its 2 minutes working at a 7 and an 8,
1 minute working at a 5 intensity. We've done 1 rep ,we're doing 8 in total. Still working that aerobic capacity
but the body is getting used to working more intermittently.
The last drill we're going into is towards the end of the off-season.
You're going to sprint from the corner flag, and as soon as you reach the corner of the 18 yard box, it's then a walk
down to the opposite corner flag in that corner. Go around the flag and then it's the same thing,
sprint to that corner of the 18 yard box. So we'll end up doing 4 sprints and we'll hit ever corner flag.
And we'll do that 3 times in total so there is 3 sets. As you go into off-season, we're going to maintain that aerobic base.
One of the things that starts to decline when you don't train everyday, your max velocity speed will start going down,
so you'll get a little slower. So now we're resting for 3 minutes and then we go again.
If we're going into pre-season in the best state we can be at that stage, then we're giving ourselves the best possible chance.
And at the end of the day this is a performance programme and all of our players need contracts so
if they don't do this, they're doing themselves a disservice.

comments.text:
6 week plan:
1.First two weeks-relax

2.Second two weeks- build up long distance by
    a.3 sets of 10 minute hourglass (run corner to corner, across goal 
line, corner to          corner, across goal line...) each hourglass should 
take a MAX of two minutes.
    b. 3 minute rest in between each ten minute set where you do exercises. 
lie on         your back and push your waist into the air, without arching 
your back. 3 sets of       5. pull your knee up, lunge, and extend your arm 
that's the same as your front         foot across your back (your chest 
should be facing sideways) and keep it               straight. 3 sets of 3 
on each leg. stand on your hands and feet and stick your           butt up 
in the air. walk your feet in with small steps until you really feel that   
          stretch in your hamstring. do 3 sets of 4 walk ins. then do 4 
forward lunges on         each leg, 4 sideways on each leg, and 4 backwards 
45 degree angle lunges on       each leg and make sure you face forward. do 
three sets. pull your knee up to           your chest and then push it so 
its extended behind you. 3 slow ones, and then         3 fast ones on each 
leg. 3 sets on each leg.
      c. run to the 6 and back, to the 18 and back, and then to halfway and 
back. 2         minutes of 70%-80% speed, then 1 minute of 50% speed.

3.Third two weeks- Build up your speed by
   a.sprinting from the corner flag to the corner of the 18, walk down the 
touchline to       the opposite corner. repeat until you've done it 4 
times. that's one rep. do three         sets of three reps, with
   b. the 3 minute rest and workout (workouts listed above) in between.﻿
